49: Dexterity is the prerequisite for the use of ranged weapons. Additionally, you'll increase your chance to hit and the attack speed by increasing your dexterity.
56: Your health is displayed at the bottom left of the screen. If an enemy hits you, your health decreases. Once it's zero, you'll die and have to load a savegame. You can increase your health by using healing potions and other consumables such as herbs.
59: During this adventure, you'll often encounter locked chests. You can open most of them by using lock picks. Unfortunately, those tend to break, making lock picking an expensive enterprise. Therefore, you should increase your lock picking skill in order to reduce the chance of a lock pick to break.
62:
Mana defines your ability to cast spells and is being shown at the bottom right of the screen. The more mana you have, the more powerful your spells will be. Each and every spell you cast uses up your mana. If your mana pool is empty, you'll have to wait for it to refill itself in order to be able to cast spells again. Moreover, there are rumours about some herbs replenishing your mana.
If you want to become a master magician, you'll have to assign learning points to your mana pool. But this is not required to win the game.
71: Your strength defines which items you can use. You have to be strong enough to use heavy weapons or armour. Additionally, your weapon damage increases if you have more strength.
79: You are not dextrous enough to use that item.
80: You are not strong enough to use this item.
82:
Defines how well you are handling different weapon categories such as one-handed, two-handed, bows or crossbows.
Both damage and attack speed are influenced by this value.
84: Would you like to enter this place?

88: You can't use your weapon any more!

98: A map from the bandits. Their hideout seems to be to the northeast, between the abbey and some farm.
100: Pearls, given to me by Tunas. Jesbar is said to pay a lot for them.

182:
You slip into the role of Xardas, an orphan, raised by farmers, who now lives in a hut in the forest.
What he doesn't know: He was chosen to fend off the misery that's befalling Khorinis!

More info at:
www.handy-games.com
185:
Be prepared to fight for your life in Gothic 3 - the beginning. Once an enemy is within reach, you just have to press the action key (preset: 5 or navigation key centre) to attack that enemy. If you hold that key pressed, he's being attacked until you have killed him. Additionally, you have the option to change your focus to other enemies with a key. (preset: *) This is quite convenient if you want to use ranged weapons or magic.
Furthermore, you can loot items even while fighting. Press the * several times until no enemy is selected. Now you can use the action key to open or gather things. By using this key, you can even scout an area by selecting enemies that are not within reach, yet.
186: The game begins in your home. Once you leave your home, you'll enter the world map. There you can travel from location to location. Frequently you'll be interrupted by random encounters which you may or may not want to experience. These might be dangerous, but also offer an opportunity to gain experience.
187:
You'll find many different items during the game. Some, like weapons, rings or armour have to be equipped to be used. Others, like healing potions or herbs are one-way items that vanish from your inventory once you've used them.
Furthermore, there are quest items that you need for special tasks. You can't sell or throw them away.
Keep in mind that you can't carry infinite amounts of items with you. If you get a warning that your inventory is full, you need to get rid of some items before you can carry any more.
201: Attack / open / pick up / examine / talk
210: Back to the previous menu layer
212: Switch between own inventory and merchant / container.
214: You can learn up to seven different magic spells in this game. You'll be able to cast them all, but their effect will be rather harmless unless you decide to invest into your mana pool.
215:
There are different skills in this game that you have to improve in order to be able to face the tougher monsters. You'll get experience points for killed monsters or solved quests. If you've gained enough experience points, you'll gain a level and, with that, learning points. Use these, plus a certain fee, to improve your skills at a trainer.
Here's an overview of your skills:

463:
I've got to try to pick this lock. For that, I'll have to push my lock picks to the left or right. If I'm lucky, the cylinder pops open and I can move on to the next one. The more complex a lock gets, the more cylinders I have to pick.
Unfortunately, my lock picks may break if I push them in the wrong direction. The higher my lock pick skill is the more unlikely it is for a lock pick to break.
